page.title: 08The Ecology of the Area.
page.content: The land is intensively farmed,and the use of{weed-killers}has resulted in a sparse{flora}in fields and hedgerows.The usual weeds of cult- ivation can be found;docks,groundsel, campions,hedge mustard etc.The most common flower is kek(cow parsley).One patch of cowslips,crosswort and wild hops can be found,and bluebells seem to be increasing slowly.Ragged Robin still grows by one of the streams.The main species of tree is ash,then oak; there are some elms left after the {Dutch elm disease. Small copses and coverts lie between fields to encourage foxes and small animals.These are the homes of badgers too. The usual farmland birds can be found and water birds are on Saddington Res- ervoir.There are many amphibians too by the numerous streams and springs.
